days.overview: Jesus begins with the Beatitudes, pronouncing blessing on the poor in spirit, those who mourn, the meek, those hungering for righteousness, the merciful, pure in heart, peacemakers, and persecuted.
days.reflection: Which beatitude speaks most to you? What does Jesus' definition of blessing challenge? How do you pursue these characteristics?
days.prayer: Ask God to form in you the character Jesus blesses.

days.overview: Jesus calls His disciples salt of the earth and light of the world, commanding them to let their light shine so others see good works and glorify God.
days.reflection: How are you salt and light? What good works make your light visible? Where might you be hiding your light?
days.prayer: Ask God to help you be salt and light, shining for His glory.

days.overview: Jesus teaches that anger is like murder—reconciliation is urgent. Don't come to worship with unreconciled relationships. Settle matters quickly.
days.reflection: Who do you need to reconcile with? How does anger relate to murder? What prevents you from seeking reconciliation?
days.prayer: Ask God to reveal any unreconciled relationships and give you courage to seek peace.

days.overview: Jesus commands loving enemies and praying for persecutors, to be sons of the Father who makes sun rise on evil and good. Be perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect.
days.reflection: Who is your enemy? How do you pray for those who persecute you? What does perfection in love mean?
days.prayer: Pray for specific enemies and persecutors, asking God for love toward them.

days.overview: Jesus warns against storing treasures on earth versus heaven. Where your treasure is, your heart will be. You cannot serve both God and money.
days.reflection: Where is your treasure? What does your spending reveal about your heart? How do you serve God rather than money?
days.prayer: Ask God to help you store treasure in heaven and serve only Him.

days.overview: Jesus commands not to be anxious about life, food, clothing. God feeds birds and clothes flowers—He will care for you. Seek first His kingdom and righteousness.
days.reflection: What do you worry about? How does God's care for creation encourage you? What does seeking His kingdom first mean?
days.prayer: Cast your anxieties on God and commit to seeking His kingdom first.

days.overview: Jesus warns against judging others while having your own faults. Remove the log from your own eye before addressing the speck in another's eye.
days.reflection: Who are you judging? What log is in your own eye? How can you address your own sin first?
days.prayer: Confess your judgmental attitudes and ask God to help you see your own faults.

days.overview: Jesus encourages asking, seeking, knocking—God gives good gifts to His children. If earthly fathers give good gifts, how much more will the heavenly Father.
days.reflection: What do you need to ask for? How does God's character as Father encourage your asking? What good gifts has He given?
days.prayer: Ask, seek, and knock, trusting your heavenly Father to give good gifts.

days.overview: Jesus concludes: whoever hears and does His words is like a wise man building on rock; whoever hears without doing is like a fool building on sand.
days.reflection: Are you a hearer only or also a doer? What foundation is your life built on? What storms have tested your foundation?
days.prayer: Commit to being a doer of Jesus' words, building on the solid rock.
